dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9595 IH: To extend the temporary order for fentanyl-related substances.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Pappas (for himself and Mr. Newhouse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To extend the temporary order for fentanyl-related substances.

section.header: Extension of temporary order for fentanyl-related substances
section.text: Effective as if included in the enactment of the Temporary Reauthorization and Study of the Emergency Scheduling of Fentanyl Analogues Act (Public Law 116–114), section 2 of such Act (as amended by Public Law 117–103) is amended by striking December 31, 2022 and inserting December 31, 2024.
